roguehouseguide-text:
Rogue House Community Rules & Server Guide Your Journey Begins... Join the Discord! - Support Rogue House - Vintage Story Wiki Welcome to Rogue House! The focus of the Rogue House is an immersive, challenging PvE experience without being too punishing. We love to survive, build, chisel, roleplay and have fun together in a constructive way.
Starter Guide - Progression Guide - Claims Guide - Chat Group Guide Rules: -Stealing is not permitted. Claimed or not, do not take things from other players. -You are not to assume a player structure is abandoned. It may not be. Ask an admin if you really think you need the place. -Cheating mods like blocksoverlay or AMFinder are not to be used here. We have an Anti-Cheat Mod that blocks client mods. Refer to the Allowed Client Mod List for mods that are permitted. Direct mod requests to our Discord. -Have some chat etiquette. Keep it more game focused. Don't flood the general chat with nonsense. Combine your messages instead of sending each thought. Use whispers "/msg PlayerName your message" and chat groups and the Proximity chat or VOIP for more personal business or adventuring parties. Building Rules: -Do not build near other claims without permission. Setting up right next door to someone without asking is rude. Leave room for others (and yourself) to be able to expand. -Do not build in or around cities without permission. This goes along with the above. They have particular requirements. -No floating over water or air path bridges. They are horribly ugly and we do not want the eye pollution in our skys or waters. They will be removed. Water bridges are acceptable only when they look nice and like an actual bridge. and of course -Be respectful to yourself and the community. Settings:
-75% Hunger Speed
-75% Food Spoilage
-Base HP Set to 15
-Items stored in a Player Corpse on Death
-30 Days per Month
-1 Game Day is 96 Minutes (Default 48)
-Calender Paused When Empty
-Chiseling for Most Blocks
-Rifts Enabled
-"Sometimes" Temporal Storms
-Propick radius of 6 (default)
-Proximity Chat Tab With RP Features
-General Chat Linked to Discord RogueRaiden: Server Owner & Builder Miriel: Server Admin & Builder
roguehouse-clientmodlist-text: Recommended Client Mods Permitted For Use Due to cheat mods on the mod database and users caught using said cheat mods, client mods are blocked unless directly allowed. This is a list of recommended mods, there are too many client mods overall to keep a list here. Direct any client mod requests to our Discord. 01. Accessibility Tweaks - Allows adjusting of nearly every sound and visual effect and more to help in all kinds of ways. Pickaxe sound on rock too loud? Piercing wolf howls? Turn them down! Open the menu with default F8. 02. Auto Walk - Adds a keybind for auto walking. 03. Butchering Fix - Press hotkey (default: Shift + B) to disable block's hitboxes where harvestable creature is in. 04. Chat Translator - Translate incoming or outgoing messages into other languages. 05. Claim Radar - Show claims with colored boxes. 06. Extra Info - Useful information for handbook, blocks, items and entities. 07. Simple Emote Menu - Adds simple menu where you can select emotes. 08. Simple Hud Clock - Adds a clock to the hud with helpful information. 09. Status HUD Continued - This is a not-so-simple mod with the objective of relaying information to the player. If your character can feel it, then you should see it. 10. Target Dot - This retextures the very large 'plus' crosshair with a much smaller 'dot' crosshair. (Both Small and Medium are allowed) 11. Temperature Scales - Allows displaying temperatures in Celsius, Fahrenheit and Kelvin. 12. Temporal Storm Gear - The Temporal Gear in the middle of your screen will turn rusty when a storm is near. 13. Tupa's Chat Mod - HTTP/HTTPS link handling, Handbook linking, moving beweet chat groups and locking your chat tab. 14. Xandus Inventory Tweaks - A collection of small tweaks to improve the inventory handling.
roguehouse-servermodlist-text: Rogue House Mod List 01. A Culinary Artillery - Library mod adding all the tools and features for enhanced foods and recipes. 02. Ancient Dungeons (Th3Dungeon) - Framework for multi room procedural dungeon generation with a few dungeons. 03. Ancient Tools - Mod adding new crafting systems and fancy carts. 04. Animation Manager Lib - a library that implements animations for held items and procedural animations for items and entities created by Maltiez. 05. Beehive Kiln - Large kiln to smelt many items. 06. Blacksmith Enhancements - Adds a few Blacksmithing related items plus quenching hot items in barrels and buckets. 07. Blacksmith Name - When a player smiths a tool or weapon, their name is displayed on that tool or weapon head and finished tool or weapon. 08. Bows - Bow model replacer. 09. Bricklayers - Utilizing Expanded Matter, this adds tons of colorful clay and glass blocks along with many decor items. Let your creativity flow! 10. Bug Net Compatibility - Allows bug net behaviour to be applied to more entities than just the flying butterfly entities. Does nothing on its own for gameplay. 11. Bullseye - Overhauled Ranged combat with a new aiming system and bow useage. 12. Butterfly Cases - A variety of display cases for anything that goes into vanilla display cases. 13. CaN Claims - GUI for the land claim system. 14. Carry On - Crouch + hold right click with both hands empty to pick up chests, vessels, crates and other things. Do the same action without targeting a block to place some blocks on your back with a speed penalty. 15. Cats - Utilizes Pet AI to add in several tameable cats with a couple accessories. 16. Chisel Tools - Iron Tier tools for significant Quality of Life features for chiselers. 17. CommonLib - Library mod for DArkHekRoMaNT's mods. 18. Config Lib - Library mod for implementing a GUI based config. 19. Crateful - Changes the insertion mechanics of crates to no longer require that the item type inside of the crate also be in your active hotbar slot. 20. Crossbows - Adds a variety of crossbows. 21. Dana Tweaks - Collection of small gameplay adjustments. 22. DecO'Clock - Adds to the game several types of mechanical clocks showing the current game time. 23. Display Case Wall - Adds a Display case for the wall. 24. Doff And Don Again - Quality of Life keybinds to quickly place your armor onto an armor stand, take from the armor stand or toss onto the ground. 25. Expanded Matter - Library mod adding lots of basic resources and ways to obtain them. 26. Expanded Foods - Utilizes A Culinary Artillery to greatly increase the available food dishes and recipes for them. 27. FairPlayGuardian - Allows restricting client mod use on servers. 28. Firearms - Adds a variety of gunpowder firearms. 29. FSM Lib - Complex behaviour library mod created by Maltiez. 30. Granary - Utilizes Piles to make grains pile-able. 31. Herbarium - Library mod for plant stuffs, new core of Wildcraft. 32. ImGUI - Library for GUI elements created by Maltiez. 33. Instruments - Pick one up and start playing some music! Uses ABC files just like Starbound or LOTR: Online to play music in-game. The server has a collection of music loaded, but the mod can also load files locally. 34. Item Frame - Placeable item frame that displays the item or block stored inside. Requires Pigment. 35. Joy of Sailing - Adds a variety of sailing boats. 36. Mannequin Stand - A mannequin to display your clothes! 37. Medieval Expansion - Draw bridges, gates, waterwheels and some other goodies. 38. Meteoric Expansion - Watch meteor showers streak through the sky, individually or in clusters. Individual meteors that crash down will destroy unprotected blocks and imbed an ore rich meteor into the area. 39. More Animals - This mod adds new animals for you to hunt or nurture as you please, such as Ring-necked Pheasants, Golden Pheasants and Capercaillies. Also adds a new nest box block which uses the recipe of the henbox, all birds can lay eggs in it and sit on it to incubate any fertile eggs held inside. The new nest box displays what species can use the nest box, what eggs are contained inside it, what species laid the eggs and whether the eggs are fertile or not when you move your mouse over the nestbox block. 40. More Roofing - More roofing blocks out of a selection of materials. 41. Night Vision Hotkey - Provides a hotkey to toggle the night vision helmet's night vision. 42. Pet AI - Library mod for taming creatures as Pets or Mounts. 43. Pileful - Changes the mechanics of pile creation, as well as taking and putting items into piles. 44. Pipeleaf - Provides pipes to smoke herb out of. 45. Piles - Library mod allowing pile behaviour to easily be added to items. 46. Player Corpse - Stashes your items into a humanoid skeleton on death with a map waypoint. 47. PlayerList - Shows a player list when you hold down tab. 48. Rogue House Additions - Custom mod for the Rogue House server. Utilizes the Pet AI and Expanded Matter libraries. Extra creatures, pets, decoritive blocks, clothing, tons of tweaks and much more! 49. RPVoiceChat - This mod implements VOIP to allow people on a server together to chat in-game based on proximity. 50. Seaweed goes in sea - Fixes some issues with Seaweed. 51. Scarecrow - Simple scarecrow that keeps some animals away from your crops.**** 52. Something in the Water - Adds a few ocean entities such as a large sun fish, shark and jellyfish. 53. Spyglass - Craftable item for getting a close look at things. 54. Stone Bake Oven - Multiblock oven for baking! 55. Stone Quarry - Use metal plugs to quarry stone in large slabs to take materials from later. 56. Storage Controller - Quickly sort items into various containers using a control block. 57. Storage Options - Various containers for storing your items. 58. Teleportation Runes - An item based 'warp' system. Craft the rune, bind it to a Beacon, then use the Rune to travel back to the bound location. 59. Vanity - Adds a GUI to toggle armor visibility. 60. Vinconomy - Player market shops. 61. VSQuest - Framework for adding quest giving entities. 62. Wildcraft: Herbs and Spices - Wildcraft module adding many herbs and spice plants. 63. Wildcraft: Fruits and Nuts - Wildcraft module adding many new fruits and nuts. 64. Wildcraft: Trees and Shrubs - Wildcraft module adding many new trees and woodtypes. 65. Wolf Taming - Utilizes Pet AI to tame wolf pups and domesticate them into dogs. Includes some armor and accessories. 66. xLib - Library mod for skill systems. 67. xSkills - Utilizes xLib for a full Skill Tree. Earn experience for a skill by performing actions under the skill. Get Ability Points on leveling the skill. Distribute your Ability Points to a skill's perks and gain powerful abilities!
roguehouse-classguide-text: Rogue House Guide to Character Classes 01. Rogue - Mixed Combat, Sneaky, Quick Slipping through the shadows, avoiding the Beasts that roam the lands. Far from the life you once had, but the only one you know of now. The Beasts have taught many lessons in stealth, ranged and melee combat. Constant movement keeps your weight down, keeping you light on your feet but less hardy. 02. Druid - Ranged Combat, Quick, Support None shall taint our forests for as long as We remain. Druids are protectors of the forests, masters of nature. They fill excellent support roles with their natural archery abilities and knowledge of plants. They despise the caves and the unnatural things within... 03. Hunter - Ranged Combat, Quick 04. Malfactor - Sneaky, 05. Commoner - Basic, no specializations 06. Tailor - Crafter 07. Clockmaker - Crafter 08. Blackguard - Melee Combat, Strong 09. Miner - Collector, Strong 10. Blacksmith - Crafter, Strong
